Package embedding.nearestNeighbors

Class NearestNeighborDescend<T>

java.lang.Object
embedding.nearestNeighbors.KNearestNeighborGraph<T>
embedding.nearestNeighbors.NearestNeighborDescend<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of objects to be compared. The used Measure must also be applicable for this type.
public class NearestNeighborDescend<T>
extends KNearestNeighborGraph<T>
NearestNeighborDescend is a randomized implementation for KNearestNeighborGraph that approximates the nearest neighbor graph.

Calculations for previous nearest neighbor graphs are reused so that calculating the neighborhood graph a second time for a different k is quicker than calculating that graph from scratch.

Author:
Anton Ballmaier

    • NearestNeighborDescend

      public NearestNeighborDescend​(int k, T[] nodes, Measure<T> measure)

      Parameters:
      k - neighborhood size
      nodes - objects to be compared
      measure - measure to compare the given objects

  • Method Details

    • nnGraph

      public AdjacencyList nnGraph()
      Constructs a nearest neighbor graph and returns it as AdjacencyList.

      The constructed neighborhood graph is only approximated and might not be completely accurate. Especially if the resulting graph is not connected errors may occur. Therefore consider constructing a neighborhood graph using a larger neighborhood size first. This will make the following construction of graphs for smaller neighborhoods more accurate, since the results from previous calculations are reused.

      Specified by:
      nnGraph in class KNearestNeighborGraph<T>
      Returns:
      the nearest neighbor graph

    • adjacencyFromNeighborhood

      private AdjacencyList adjacencyFromNeighborhood()
      Constructs an AdjacencyList from the internal graph representation.
      Returns:
      the AdjacencyList representing the generated neighborhood graph

    • initalizeNeighborhood

      private void initalizeNeighborhood()
      Initializes the neighborhood of each node with random other nodes.

    • randomSample

      private <S> java.util.Collection<S> randomSample​(java.util.Collection<S> set, int samples)
      Returns a number of random samples from a given Collection. Given elements cannot be picked twice.
      Type Parameters:
      S - the type of elements in the set
      Parameters:
      set - the elements to pick from
      samples - the number of samples to pick.
      Returns:
      a random sample from the given Collection. If samples>=set.size() the given Collection is simply returned.

    • tryNearestNeighborUpdates

      private void tryNearestNeighborUpdates​(int u1, int u2)
      Tries to perform an update on the neighborhood for two items (defined by their indices u1 and u2) that take part in a local join.

      More specifically this method does the following:

      • Test if u1 is in u2's kNN and the other way around.
      • Update the nearest neighbor heap if one of the u1, u2 has a place in the others k-neighborhood.
      • Add to the update counter for the changes in the kNNG.
      Parameters:
      u1 - the index of the first element for a potential update
      u2 - the index of the second element for a potential update

    • updateNearestNeighbors

      private void updateNearestNeighbors​(int node, int newNeighbor, double distance, NearestNeighborDescend.WeightedIndex worstNeighbor)
      Checks whether a new neighbor with a given distance should be in the nearest neighbors and (if applicable) replaces the worst (meaning farthest) neighbor in that heap.
      Parameters:
      node - the index of the node whose neighborhood might be updated
      newNeighbor - the index of the node that might be added as a new neighbor
      distance - the distance of the two nodes in question
      worstNeighbor - the current farthest nearest neighbor
